message.content:
cs.AR, cs.DC, cs.PF, cs.SY, cs.SE 

This paper focuses on energy efficiency in computing systems, specifically in the context of high-performance computing (HPC) facilities. Therefore, it is likely to fall under the following arXiv CS sub-categories: 

- cs.AR (Hardware Architecture): This sub-category covers research on computer hardware design and architecture, which is relevant to the evaluation of DVFS techniques on modern HPC processors and accelerators. 
- cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing): This sub-category covers research on distributed and parallel computing systems, which is relevant to the evaluation of energy efficiency in HPC facilities. 
- cs.PF (Performance): This sub-category covers research on performance analysis and optimization, which is relevant to the evaluation of trade-offs between energy-to-solution and time-to-solution. 
- cs.SY (Systems and Control): This sub-category covers research on control systems and optimization, which is relevant to the energy-performance model used in the analysis of the results. 
- cs.SE (Software Engineering): This sub-category covers research on software development and engineering, which is relevant to the instrumentation of the code for power consumption and execution time monitoring.
